subject: Psychology
title: Pavlov and Classical Conditioning
description: A 60-second lesson on Pavlov and Classical Conditioning.

hook.text: A dog hears a bell and starts drooling ‚Äî even though there's no food. The bell now means dinner.

buildup.text: Ivan Pavlov discovered classical conditioning accidentally while studying digestion in dogs.

discovery.text: By pairing a neutral stimulus (bell) with food repeatedly, the bell alone triggered salivation.

twist.text: Classical conditioning explains phobias, advertising, and even why you feel hungry when you smell a bakery.

climax.text: Pavlov showed that learning can happen automatically, without thought. The body learns before the mind notices.

punchline.text: Ring a bell enough times with food and the bell becomes food.

quiz.question: What did Pavlov discover through his experiments with dogs?
